alert.note: Alert for Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 04 at 4:57AM MST until March 04 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR EASTERN DOUGLAS, ELBERT, AND LINCOLN COUNTIES... * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zones 241, 246 and 247. * Timing... Friday, 11 AM to 8 PM MST. * Winds...Southwest 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 11 percent. * Impacts...Any fires that develop are likely to spread rapidly. Outdoor burning should be avoided, as well as any activities that may cause sparks.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County
